subject: Re: [PATCH v4 03/25] io_uring/kbuf: add support for kernel-managed buffer rings

reviews.author: Joanne Koong (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Joanne Koong clarified that the patch for kernel-managed buffer rings is separate from zero-copying and discussed its purpose in minimizing memory footprint.

reviews.author: Caleb Mateos
reviews.summary: Caleb raised a question about how the io_uring_fixed_index_get() and io_uring_fixed_index_put() functions can return different results, but also gave a Reviewed-by tag indicating overall approval of the patch.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Bernd Schubert raised several minor issues and questions about the io_uring/kbuf patches, including a potential bug in fuse_copy_do(), unused flags, missing 'if bl' condition, unclear parameter 'buf_group', and requested documentation for liburing calls.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Reviewer Bernd Schubert raised concerns about initialization of cs->len in fuse_copy_fill and pointed out a potential exception in recycling logic for kernel-managed buffer rings.

reviews.author: Christoph Hellwig
reviews.summary: Christoph Hellwig suggested splitting the patch series into smaller ones for easier review, requested documentation for the uapi, and provided several technical suggestions to improve the code.

reviews.author: Askar Safin
reviews.summary: The reviewer questioned whether kernel-managed buffer rings (kbufs) solve the same problem as splice, and referenced a quote from Linus Torvalds suggesting that kbufs are a modern version of splice.
